title: Mr and Mrs Smith reboot to star Phoebe Waller-Bridge and Donald Glover
description: The original 2005 film about married assassins starred Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie.

title: McConnell blames 'Trump's lies' but votes not guilty
description: Republican Mitch McConnell calls the former president's actions a “disgraceful dereliction of duty”.

title: Townsend questions red card & late penalty in Scotland loss to Wales
description: Scotland head coach Gregor Townsend questions Zander Fagerson's red card and a last-minute penalty call as his side are edged out by Wales.

title: Dutch take to the ice as canals and lakes freeze over
description: People in the Netherlands are making the most of wintry weather that has frozen local waterways.

title: Covid: We could live with virus 'like we do flu' by end of year, says Hancock
description: But scientists warn against treating coronavirus like the flu, with mutations getting "more dangerous".

title: Nadal beats Norrie to end British interest in Australian Open singles
description: Rafael Nadal beats an impressive Cameron Norrie to reach the Australian Open fourth round and end British interest in the singles.

title: Rohit's 161 gives India edge over England on compelling first day of Test
description: England are given a stark reminder of the challenge of touring India by Rohit Sharma's classy 161 on day one of the second Test.

title: Covid vaccine: Over-70s urged to get vaccine as UK nears target
description: The government is aiming to offer a vaccine to 15 million people in priority groups by Monday.

title: India icon Kohli is bowled by Moeen - but refuses to walk
description: India captain Virat Kohli needs a replay on the big screen to convince him to leave the crease after being bowled by England's Moeen Ali.

title: Everton manager Carlo Ancelotti's Crosby home burgled
description: Police appeal for information after two offenders stole a safe from the Merseyside property.

title: Burst pipe leaves thousands without water in Glasgow
description: More than 50,000 homes and businesses in Glasgow are left without supplies and several roads are flooded.

title: Disruption as snow moves across Northern Ireland
description: Travel has been affected and sporting fixtures called off amid the yellow weather warning.

title: Scottish secondary pupils could face 2m rule
description: A Scottish government advisory group says the measure should apply when schools begin a phased return this month.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Will Covid be with us forever, like flu?
description: Vaccination is unlikely to provide a permanent defence, writes Dr John Wright, so Covid may never be eliminated.

title: Treasury scraps £95,000 cap on public sector pay-offs
description: Unions fought the move, saying it would have hit workers on salaries of £25,000 a year.

title: Couple bailed after death of boy they were adopting
description: The one-year-old boy who died was living with the couple as they awaited a final adoption order.

title: Medvedev's coach walks out of match as he blows two-set lead
description: Daniil Medvedev's coach walks out of his Australian Open third-round match as the Russian blows a two-set lead before winning.

title: Trump lawyers' three key impeachment arguments
description: On the fourth day of the impeachment trial, the former president’s defence set out their case.

title: Covid-19: Hope for treatable virus, final vaccine push, and lockdown museums
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday morning.

title: Greene King Black Boy pubs renamed in 'anti-racist' move
description: A pub chain's boss said research found people felt some of its premises' names were racist.

title: In pictures: Inside an intensive care ward in the middle of a pandemic
description: Newsbeat spent two days inside Harrogate District Hospital. This is what we saw.

title: Remembering Viola Beach five years on
description: Five years after rising stars Viola Beach died in a crash, their families consider the band's legacy.

title: Newspaper headlines: A 'road map' out of lockdown?
description: As the UK nears 15 million vaccinations, the front pages examine when lockdown might be eased.

title: Covid: Claims vaccinations harm fertility unfounded
description: Social-media posts - some described as "scare stories" - are based on misunderstandings, experts say.

title: Covid: What can families do over the half-term break?
description: With restrictions still in place, parents will need to be creative to keep the children entertained.

title: CaSSIS mission: The camera capturing Mars' craters and canyons
description: The instrument takes images of dust storms, frost deposits and minerals on the Red Planet's surface.

title: Covid-19: The secret life of museums during lockdown
description: Museums and art galleries are closed but inside their walls, a select few people are busy at work.

title: Steve Cotterill: Shrewsbury manager with Covid winning from hospital
description: Steve Cotterill is recovering in hospital but is still leading Shrewsbury Town from his sick bed.

title: Week in pictures: 6-12 February 2021
description: A selection of striking images taken around the world this week.

title: Nasa's pioneering black women
description: The mathematicians who worked behind the scenes on the American space programme.

title: How I bickered and bonded with a Spotify hacker
description: Eloise Horsfield communicated with her hacker through song titles picked via the music-streaming app.

title: Neglected rescue dogs get makeovers from RSPCA
description: Some of the animals were in such a bad state their breeds were unrecognisable.

title: How Mike Pence became a villain in Trump world
description: A pro-Trump mob called the loyal former vice-president a traitor who should be hanged. What changed?

title: Myanmar coup: What led to the military seizing power?
description: The people of Myanmar watched a coup unfold on 1 February. Why are they scared?
